intro: Hieracium violascens, commonly known as the violet hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant produces small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has a rosette of basal leaves and a hairy stem that supports its flowering heads. Hieracium violascens is often found in meadows and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soil.
